file_content.text: It's a hangar, you twit. Just keep monitoring it, and notify me if anything--even an insect--flies out.
I do hope I'm not the only competent Sith on this planet. The Republic is amassing a fleet, and I need someone capable to step in.
My power knows no bounds.
There's no one stronger.
Your confidence nearly rivals my own.
The recent increase in carrier activity led me to suspect the Republic was stockpiling a secret hangar of sorts. As always, I was right.
The hangar itself is still under construction, but the fleet they've assembled easily dwarfs our own.
If I had the firepower here to do so, I'd already be dancing over its charred ruins.
Bring out the artillery and level the place.
Blow it up.
Even I couldn't have predicted they'd build it so close. It's the rare insect that hides under a boot.
An orbital bombardment ought to reduce that hangar to dust. But first, my fleet will need the hangar's exact coordinates.
Make sure you wait until I get out before you start the fireworks.
Yeah, just be careful.
You have my word.
The Republic knows the hangar is vulnerable, so they'll be prepared. Just storm past their defenses and plant those beacons.
By the time they realize what you were up to, we'll already be raining fire upon them.
Perfect--the beacons are feeding the hangar's coordinates to my ships as we speak.
Once the fleet is in position, we can commence the bombardment and turn that hangar into a smoldering crater.
I couldn't keep your actions a secret if I tried. Already my men are abuzz with talk of your daring assault. It's almost humbling.
Excellent work out there. I doubt I could have done a better job of it myself.
I do hope your reputation is well earned, bounty hunter. The Republic is amassing a fleet, and I need a seasoned professional to handle it.
Foresight is but one of my many qualities. I've gleaned more from simple intuition than from these myopic fools.
Service to the Empire should be its own reward.
I'll keep an eye out for the explosions.
Looking forward to it.
Please do. It will be quite the spectacle.
Mission complete?
Quite.
Don't hog all the credit.
Your master is a fool, and you're a fool for following him.
How can you work for this guy?
The fleet is already standing by. Our success depends on you now.
I trust your dossier isn't a load of tripe. The Republic is amassing a fleet, and I need someone experienced to neutralize it.
I hope you're all as capable as you look. The Republic is amassing a fleet, and I need tested veterans to intervene.
Modesty forbids me from listing my many, many triumphs.
I don't like to brag, but....
Braggarts and phonies don't last long in my line of work.
I'm the real deal.
My record speaks for itself.
My service is flawless.
It sounds as though you already knew the hangar was there.
You don't seem surprised.
Uh-oh.
Indeed.
Watch and learn.
Lord Vago?
This is a time for action--he will speak to me. Now.
That is your master's job.
It can be so hard to focus one's rage with all the world's little distractions.
I can sympathize.
You're telling me he's too busy thinking to talk to anybody?
Are you serious?
Has the situation changed, to lead your master into such deep thoughts?
Is there a problem?
Does your master ever deal with people himself?
Another lackey.
What about searching for the Republic's project?
And the hidden weapon?
That sounds like a job for the military, not me.
Why bother me with this?
The Republic has to realize we're closing in. It's only a matter of time until they act.
Let's hope we act in time.
Killing soldiers and deploying droids? This is the work you couldn't do without help?
That's all?
The leader of our enemies will fall with the rest.
It will be done.
Perhaps this Kamden will know something about what the Republic's been up to out here....
Sounds like an opportunity.
Any extra credits to go with the extra risk?
Will I get paid more?
You forget who you're speaking to. I'll handle it.
Of course I can get inside.
My lord has returned to his meditations. I think it's best if you be on your way.
All ships are in position. Stand by for orbital assault.
My master is as generous as he is wise. Colonel Surab will have your reward waiting for you when you return.
Perfect.
Perfect.
I thought this would be awful.
I'm... glad that you approve.
Farewell, then.
I... don't know what you mean. My master is unparalleled--we could never have accomplished this operation without his insights.
I think you'd best be going now.
My lord? The probes have returned. The data is coming through now... what is that?
How do we proceed?
They built an entire fleet?
This team can plant beacons in the hangar's vicinity, and our ships will destroy the Republic's greatest secret weapon in a single rain of fire. Brilliant, my lord.
Let's talk pay.
My master is still occupied by his meditations. Please see to your task so that we may see to ours.
Ah... with respect, please, refrain from disturbing my master. He is meditating deeply and... dislikes interruptions. I'm Lieutenant Trell--Lord Vago has authorized me to relay his instructions.
The life of a Sith is beyond my understanding. I merely serve.
Lord Vago's decisions can seem odd to those of us who lack his... insight. But his methods and results are above reproach.
Not at all. Lord Vago simply refuses to cease his analysis until he feels he has exhausted every avenue of thought.
So be it.
Oh, of course. My master is a man of direct action. Were he not otherwise occupied, he would certainly speak to you himself.
Our hunt for the Republic's secret project is opposed by elite Special Forces soldiers. We must annihilate them to accomplish our goal.
Our troops have encircled the region, maintaining pressure from all sides. While the enemy is thus distracted, you will strike directly at their forces and obliterate them.
Killing sounds good.
That's... good to hear.
We are fulfilling our role in the operation as outlined by Lord Vago. He has deemed this task suitable for more... specialized talents.
As you assault the enemy, you will also deploy small probes to help us pinpoint exactly where the Republic is hiding this secret weapon they've been constructing.
This was my lord's assessment as well--a rapid resolution is part of the reason he chose to invite your assistance.
Sounds like a plan.
Sounds like a plan.
Our enemies are highly trained, well equipped and know the terrain. Conducting this operation will not be as easy as you make it seem.
There is one other matter: the leader of the Republic defenders, Major Kamden. His death could only speed our progress.
Kamden coordinates his soldiers from a heavily fortified base--it's practically impenetrable. If you were to hijack a Republic speeder, though, you might be able to get inside.
Kamden will sooner die than reveal his secrets. He's a dangerous man, made even more dangerous by his cyborg enhancements--be cautious, my lord.
Of course. But Kamden is no simple target--he has extensive cyborg enhancements, and a brilliant mind to match. Use caution.
We'll see.
If you do pursue Kamden, be warned--he's a shrewd man, made even more dangerous by his extensive cyborg enhancements.
I'll burn their base to ash.
Be cautious. Kamden is a shrewd leader with extensive cyborg enhancements. He will not fall easily.
Here are the probes you'll need to deploy. My fellow soldiers can tell you best how to strike at the enemy's forces.
Good luck.
